title: Snapchat: How to Look at Snaps You've Sent + FAQs

steps.title: Sign up for Snapchat+.
steps.content: Sign up for Snapchat+. Snapchat has recently added a feature to Snapchat+ that allows you to replay your previously sent Snaps. You must be a Snapchat+ subscriber to use this feature. [1] X Research source To sign up for Snapchat+, tap your profile picture in the upper-left corner of the screen, then tap the gear icon. Tap Snapchat+ > Subscribe . Snapchat+ is $3.99 per month in the US. The price may vary depending on where you live. If you haven't signed up for Snapchat+ before, Snapchat may offer you a few months of Snapchat+ at a lower price as an introductory deal.

steps.title: Tap on a chat.
steps.content: Tap on a chat. Back out of your Snapchat settings and tap on the "Chat" tab, then choose a chat that has the snap you want to replay.

steps.title: Scroll up until you find the Snap.
steps.content: Scroll up until you find the Snap. There will be no indication of what the Snap looked like in the chat. If you aren't sure when you sent the Snap you want to see, you might need to try out a few Snaps to find the correct one.

steps.title: Long-press on the Snap.
steps.content: Long-press on the Snap. After tapping and holding for a second or two, a menu will pop up with a few options.

steps.title: Tap Replay.
steps.content: Tap Replay . This option has a star next to it, denoting that it's a Snapchat+ feature. Once you tap Replay , the Snap will replay. You can then screenshot the Snap if you need to save it for later.

steps.title: Open Snapchat and take a Snap.
steps.content: Open Snapchat and take a Snap. Tap the circular "Capture" button to take a picture, or hold it down for up to 60 seconds to take a video. You can add effects to the snap before saving it if you like.

steps.title: Tap the "Download" arrow.
steps.content: Tap the "Download" arrow. It's a downward-facing arrow in the bottom-left corner of the screen. If this is your first time saving a Snap to your phone, a pop-up menu will appear. If you've downloaded Snaps before, skip this step and the next two steps. If you've enabled downloading to Memories but not your Camera Roll, you can enable downloads for the Camera Roll by tapping your profile icon on the main Snapchat page, tapping the Settings gear, tapping Memories , tapping Save Button , and tapping Memories & Camera Roll .

steps.title: Tap Memories & Camera Roll when prompted.
steps.content: Tap Memories & Camera Roll when prompted. This is in the pop-up menu.

steps.title: Tap Save.
steps.content: Tap Save . It's a purple button at the bottom of the pop-up menu. If prompted, tap OK or ALLOW to let Snapchat access your Photos app in order to complete the download.

steps.title: Send your Snap.
steps.content: Send your Snap. Tap the "Send" arrow, select at least one recipient, and tap the "Send" arrow again to send the Snap.

steps.title: View your Snap.
steps.content: View your Snap. Now that you've saved your Snap to both Snapchat's Memories feature and your smartphone's Photos app, you can view it in both places: [2] X Research source Memories : Tap the two cards below the "Capture" circle on the main Snapchat screen, then tap the photo you want to open. Camera Roll : Open your smartphone's Photos app, then find the saved Snap and tap it to open it. Snapchat will create a "Snapchat" album for photos saved from within Snapchat.

steps.title: Open Snapchat and tap your profile icon.
steps.content: Open Snapchat and tap your profile icon. It's in the top-left corner of the screen. Your profile page will appear.

steps.title: Tap the small ghost icon under the "My Account" button.
steps.content: Tap the small ghost icon under the "My Account" button. It's in between your birthday and your Zodiac sign.

steps.title: Review your Snapscore.
steps.content: Review your Snapscore. The pop up will display how many Snaps you've sent/viewed, how many Snaps you've received, and how many Snaps you've added to stories.

steps.title: Can I view my sent Snaps if I download my Snapchat data?
steps.content: Can I view my sent Snaps if I download my Snapchat data? No, your Snapchat data doesn't actually have your Snaps. The Snap history in your Snapchat data is just a list of the people you've Snapchatted.

steps.title: How do I rewatch a Snap someone else sent me?
steps.content: How do I rewatch a Snap someone else sent me? If you haven't exited the chat yet, press and hold on a Snap you received, then tap Replay to rewatch it. You can only rewatch a Snap one time. If you exit a chat, you won't be able to replay a snap. [3] X Research source You can replay a Snap multiple times if you subscribe to Snapchat+.

steps.title: Can Snapchat see your Snaps?
steps.content: Can Snapchat see your Snaps? Snapchat claims they don't scan or view your snaps or chats unless someone reports them. [4] X Research source However, it's very likely they could (and will) view and share your Snaps with authorities if subpoenaed by law enforcement.
